title.rendered: Taking pictures, Trying to see inside flat, spitting on chairs, cig in pet water | 21st September 2024

content.rendered:
Summery:
—1. On September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, Nathaniel Beach was seen
——walking around the property with a mobile device, potentially recording or
——viewing the interior of the reporter’s flat.
—2. He was observed at the reporter’s front door, seemingly recording the entryway.
—3. Later in the evening, he engaged in more concerning behavior:
——◉ Standing at the front door and checking for witnesses
——◉ Spitting on chairs near the property
——◉ Pacing outside and looking at the camera
——◉ Deliberately placing a cigarette end in an outdoor pet water bowl
—1. His actions appeared calculated, including retreating backwards while
——maintaining eye contact with the door, as if waiting for a reaction.
—2. Incidents from 6:30 PM onwards were reported to the police via their online chat
——system due to high call volumes.
—3. A police appointment is scheduled for Sunday at 10 PM, and the matter will be
——further reported to WDH on Monday.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDH  | The Police via 101

Details:
On Saturday, September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, the resident of flat number 14, Mr. Nathaniel Beach, was observed via surveillance cameras once again engaging in suspicious behavior around our property.
The individual was seen holding a mobile device while walking around outside our flat.
He briefly moved out of camera range for approximately 30 seconds before returning to his flat.
11:32 AM: Our living room camera captured him outside our property, holding his phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or attempting to view the interior of our bedroom and living room windows.
11:33 AM: he was observed at our front door (One minute later).
His actions, including moving his phone up and down while looking around, indicated he was more than likley recording our entryway.
He then returned to his flat.
6:30 PM: he was observed standing at our front door, staring, then moving towards the bin area before returning. His behavior suggested he was checking for witnesses.
7:05 PM: he left his residence, heading towards the park up the hill.
7:30 PM: Upon returning, he crossed the grass towards our bins, paused, then approached the chairs, spat on them, and proceeded to his flat.
10:21 PM: he was then seen pacing outside.
10:22 PM: He walked past the window, looking at the camera while smoking.
10:24 PM: he then passed by again, moving towards the front of the property.
10:25 PM: he approached our front door and stood staring for several seconds. He attempted to discard his cigarette in our outdoor pet water bowl, initially missing. He then bent down, retrieved the cigarette end, and deliberately placed it in the water.
He retreated backwards, maintaining his gaze on the door, seemingly waiting for a reaction. After pausing at a distance, he moved towards our bins before returning to his flat.
All incidents from 6:30 PM onwards have been reported to the police via their online chat system, as advised due to high call volumes. The report has been forwarded to PC O’Neil.
This matter will be further reported to WDH on Monday, following the scheduled police appointment on Sunday at 10 PM.
